metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3436 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenTTD 0.6.0 through 1.2.1 does not properly validate requests to clear a water tile, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and server crash) via a certain sequence of steps related to "the water/coast aspect of tiles which also have railtracks on one half."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

openttd - 1.2.3-1
openttd-data - 1.2.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openttd package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.3-1').
